title: Book Cover, Creative Intuition in Art and Poetry by Jacques Maritain, 1955
title_raw: Creative Intuition in Art and Poetry by Jacques Maritain
signed: Signature printed vertically, lower right: lustig.
inscribed:
Printed in black ink, front cover upper right: The A.W. Mellon Lectures in the Fine Arts/by JACQUES MARITAIN; left center: in art; lower right: Published by the Noonday Press/M8 $1.95. Printed in green ink, front cover left: creative/poetry. Printed in white ink, front cover left: intuition/and; lower left: MERIDIAN BOOKS.

Printed vertically in white ink, side cover: creative intuition/MERIDIAN BOOKS; printed horizontally in white ink, side cover, bottom: M8. Printed vertically in green ink, side cover: in art and poetry. Printed vertically in black ink, side cover: JACQUES MARITAIN.

Printed in white ink, back cover upper left: intuition/and; printed in green ink, back cover left: creative/poetry. Printed in black ink, back cover: in art/The A.W. Mellon Lectures in the Fine Arts/by JACQUES MARITAIN/In this volume Jacques Maritain proposes to make/both the distinction and the indissoluble rela-/tionship between art and poetry. He insists on the/part played by the intellect in both art and poetry,/and especially on the fact that poetry has its source/in the intuitve activity of the internet./In the process of illuminating his argument, Pro-/fessor Maritain discusses the poetry of Eliot and/Thomas, the painting of Roualt and Picasso, the/music of Bach and Mozart, the philosophy of Plato,/Aristotle, and St. Thomas Aquainus./"(Jacques Maritain) is the most powerful force in/contemporary French philosophy." TS ELIOT/All Meridian Books are Smyth-Sewn for Durability.
provenance: Susan Lustig Peck; 2001: acquired by Museum
description: Pink background with title printed in green, white, and black ink.

tombstone.epitaph:
Book Cover, Creative Intuition in Art and Poetry by Jacques Maritain, 1955. Lithograph on thin matted paper. 
Gift of Susan Lustig Peck. 2001-29-10
